title: Portrait of a young woman, possibly Hélène David d'Angers, the artist's daughter
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Pierre-Jean David D'Angers [1788-1856], Paris, France [1]; given to his son, Robert David d'Angers [ 1833-1912], Paris and Neuilly-sur-Seine, France, 1853 [2]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ by June 12, 1974 [3]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.

Notes:
[1]. The artist made the drawing while staying in Nice, France in early 1853.
[2]. The drawing is isncribed "à mon cher Robert" and is signed and dated 1853. This is the appellation used at this time in the letters written by the artist to his son. See M. Henry Jouin, " David d'Angers et ses relations litttéraires," Librairie Plon, Paris, 1890.
[3]. Daniel and Jane Fishkoff loaned the work to the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute in June 1974; see curatorial file for original loan form and list of works.

creator.birth_place: Angers (Maine-et-Loire, Pays de la Loire, France)
creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
